page.title: 07THE BROOK IN CRUDWELL
page.content: There are{two sources to the brook {which runs through Crudwell village. One is close to the Fossway near Fosse Gate and the other is near Chedglow Barn.The two brooks meet on the east side of Crudwell and flow on until{they join Braydon Brook.}One part of the brook{flows through the {centre of the village}past the Post Office and the school field.Outside the Post Office is{a ford across the {brook.}It is too narrow for cars to use. Sightings of water birds are rare but children have seen{a duck with {a family of ducklings}earlier this year. The water in the brook looks very clear and{a wide variety of {creatures}live in it.Some parts have so much weed growing in them that they look like minature jungles.
